pullRequest.title: SAMZA-2448: [Scala cleanup] Clean up and convert some parts of samza-kafka to java
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issues: Most of samza-kafka is now in Java, so it would be good to convert more classes from Scala to Java. Some Java classes are within the src/main/scala directory.
Changes:

Moved some classes around so that they are in the proper location.
Rewrote KafkaUtil.scala into KafkaUtil.java
Removed some unused classes

Testing: ./gradlew build
API changes: None
Upgrade/usage instructions: None

commit.message: moved java files to java directory, deleted unused scala classes, added KafkaUtilJava

nodes.bodyText: Did you leave it out as is and plan to rewrite these tests when KafkaCheckpointManager is rewritten in Java?
Did any of your change force to separate out the tests or is it more of a clean up?
Does it have to be boxed? Can we replace this w/ primitive?
